result.execSummary:
The defendant James F Baird was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).
  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  psycological exam to completed.   DNA sample unless already done.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James F Baird in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called appearances given.  Pre-Sentence Investigation report has been review by the parties.  No victim rights issues.  PSI is scanned into the case for the court to review also.  Court asks parties if there are any errors in the PSI.  State was not aware of any.  Deft said that there were errors.  Court to review errors with the deft.  Page 3 - of PSI was read by the deft.  No other erros.  Ms Jennifer Priekschad (writer of the PSI) is questioned by the court.  Statement made.

Court orders:
3 years probation w/held - not opposed to transfer to Michigan
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court. - both counts
  Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
   psycological assessment to be completed
  DNA sample unless already done.
97 days sentence credit.
From Judge Tlusty to Deft J. Baird
Property Receipt
Sentencing hearing on 11/7/16@ 9:00 am

Defendant James F Baird in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by Zengler -  Defendant states he is being denied access to phone (states his phone, cell phone) Statements by Manninen - The Jail phone is available in the day room - Baird states the phone does not work - Defendant states his PIN does not work - Public defenders office calls are free calls - Other numbers are "fee" associated calls - Defendant's father can be put on visitor list (father would have to fill out information on computer in the jail lobby - Defendant states Gisselman is his attorney and she has been paid but does not show up - Mother has paid the money - Defendant states he would like to use his lap top - May not use a personal lap top - In the legal law library there is a computer and law books that can be used - Defendant would need to make a paper request to use Law Library - Defendant is considered High Security and will not be able to have handcuffs removed - Defendant is calling this court a monkey court - Hearing is terminated - Defendant is no longer in the courtroom - State has checked jail records and defendant "James Baird" is the only James Baird in the jail at this time
Jail Administrator David Manninen
Sentencing hearing on November 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.
read by the court
after verdict received.
For Counts 1&2
Voir Dire List
written question from Juror #232
VOIDED - Master Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Master - Juror Selection and Peremptory
Court reads instructions to the jury.
Instruction 70 - Preliminary Instruction: Defendant Proceeding Pro Se

Defendant James F Baird in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Court addresses the deft as to wearing the belt.  Deft is allowed to stand during the trial.  Court will inform the jury the deft is standing due to medical reasons.  Preliminary jury instructions were handed out to the State and Deft.   State gives the court a list of witnesses along with giving the deft a copy of the list.  Court questions the officers as to how a sidebar will take place.  The jury will be excused if a sidebar is to take place.  Note taking by the jurors will be allowed.  Jurors are allowed to ask questions after a witness is questioned.  No Miranda/Goodchild issues.  Deft was never questioned. - MV 

Brief recess. Recalled at 8:50 am. Discussions as to procedures. Witnesses have agreed to swear on a bible. Jurors brought in @ 9:12 am. Juror 624 excused. Brief recess for deft to use the restroom. Continued jury selection. Issue with how the chairs are number. Court addresses Mr Baird as to how the chairs are numbered.  Re do the peremptory Challenges. Jury selection completed @ 11 am. Jurors released for a short break.  - DB

CoC confirms that no Jury Trial was set on this case for 8/10/16.  Back on the record at  11:15 AM w/jurors brought into the courtroom.  Court reads the preliminary jury instructions to the jurors.  Opening statments at 11:25 am.  Opening statements done at 11:35 am.  Bailiff hands out the notepads to the jury.  Jailor Timothy Kurtz  duly sworn w/the bible and testifies.  Witness Id'd the deft in court. Record is to reflect that the deft has been id'd.  Court would like to take a lunch break at this time 12:00 pm.  Jurors to be back at 1:20 pm.

Back on the record at 1:33 pm  Jurors are brought in.  CO Pamela Steffenhagen duly sworn w/bible and testifies. Witness id'd the deft in court.  The record is to reflect the deft has been id'd.  Court strikes the argumentative questions.  Jurors are to disregard any mannerisms of the Judge.  CO Amber Gorell  duly sworn w/bible and testifies.  Deft makes another comment.  Court directs the jury to disregard the comment.  A question from a juror.  State to review question,  Deft review the question.  Neither party objects to the question from Juror #232.  State follows up with a question of the witness after the question of the juror.  State rests at 2:28 pm  Be back on the record in 10 minutes  Court questions the deft if he is going to testify.  Court will ask the questions of the deft after the break.  Back on the record at 2:45 pm.  Court questions the deft if he wants to testify.   Deft informs the court that he would like to testify.  Court advises the deft as to his rights to testify.  Court finds that the deft FVI to testify.  Jurors are back at 2:50 pm.  Deft James Baird  duly sworn w/bible and testifies. Defense rests at 2:54 pm.  The evidence is in at 2:54 pm.  Court to go over the jury instructions w/State and Defense.  Jurors are excused at 2:56 pm.  Back on the record at 3:15 pm.  Both parties agree on the jury instructions.  Jurors are back at 3:17 pm.  Court reads the instructions to the jury.   State makes closing arguement at 3:29 pm. Defense gives his closing arguements 3:37 pm.  Court finishes reading the jury instructions.  Oath read to the bailiff's.  Jury is excused at 3:45 pm .  Court asks the parties if the instruction were read correctly.  Both parties agreed that they were.

Back on the record at 4:08 pm Verdict reached.  Juror are back in court at 4:08 pm   Verdict is read by Juror #43.  Court reads the verdicts.

Count 1 - guilty
Count 2 - guilty

Jurors are polled by the court.   Court informs the jury their duty is completed and are dismissed at 4:13 pm.  State moves for judgment of the verdict.  Court direct the clerk to enter judgment.

State requests that a PSI be ordered.  Court grants the request.    Deft is raising concerns of the treatment of the jail.  State feels that a hearing should be held regarding these issues.
to attorney.

Defendant James F Baird in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given at 9:33 am.  Stand by counsel is not available.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Court asks the deft what happened at the 9:00 am hearing in Branch II.  The report states he is competent.  The hearing has been adjourned in Branch II.  Deft not sure why it was adjourned.  COC M Peterson addresses the court as to the hearing in Br II.  The adjournment was because the doctor was not available and the State did not have the most recent report.  Also Attorney Gisselman will be in the attorney on both cases.  The JA from Br II will confirm the attorney status.  Court does not review the Waiver of right to attorney form at this time.  Br II record reflects that Gavin was the attorney but withdrew because the deft would not work with the attorney.  Deft would need to reapply with the Public Def.  Deft advises the court they  have privately hired an attorney.  Court advises the deft as to the up coming Jury Trial.  Court addresses the deft if he is requesting an adjournment of the Jury Trial.  The deft's reply is to not adjourn the jury trial with or without an attorney.  MV 
Court asks if Deft and State would like to proceed. State would like to proceed. Court requests from Clerk clarification if money has been posted on behalf of Deft. Per records, no money has been posted. Court addresses competency. Court reviews Br II minutes regarding competency. Deft found competent in December of 2015 and in most recent evaluation. Waiver of Right to Attorney reviewed by Court. Form recieved on 7/21/16. Deft wishes to review document again. Justfication as to why the box will remain unchecked provided by Deft. Deft does not want attorney to speak on his behalf but advise only. He wishes to have an attorney on standby only and will rely on Gisselman to provide this service. Court moves to read/review signed waiver with Deft. Signature affirmed. Clarifies ability to read/write and understand English language. Deft can read/understand and type with spelling aid. Court explains Jury Trial, Voir Dire and strike process. Court finds that the Deft knowingly, willingly and intelligently waives his write to an attorney. Court accepts the waiver of counsel. Court addresses the right to wear "street clothes". Adjourned at 10:41 MP
Hearing on July 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant James F Baird in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Victim rights complied with.  Deft still does not have an attorney.  Court advises the deft might be forf his right to an attorney.  Court asks Officer Schneider as to what is happening at the jail.  Ofc Schneider does not know.  Deft informs the court he does not want an attorney.  Waiver of rights to an attorney was given to the officer to give to the deft at the jail.
TJK Lincoln County Jail
PKS, AG - Lincoln County Jail
Judicial Pretrial - in court on July 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James F Baird in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Brief recess for parties to talk.  No agreement reached.  The deft is eligible for a court appointed attorney but is not sure if he wants one. The deft might be forfeiting his right to an attorney. A Jury trial is set.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on July 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status hearing on July 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James F Baird in court, in custody via video.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant - Defendant addresses court - States everbody lies and he wants to be put in a real jail - Statements by Zengler - Defendant states he wants a plea bargain - Plea agreement to be sent to defendant in jail - Clerk to send form to attention of Mr. Baird agreement to meet with DA & phone numbers of attorneys  - Defendant to give form to jailer and they are to return to DA's office  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Status conference on May 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
This petition is granted at a rate of $70 per month to begin on 5/5/16

Defendant James F Baird in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dave Maninnen appears for LISO.  Case called appearances given.  State addresses the court and informs the court that he is not eligible for a Public Defender to handle his case.  Now the deft states that he does not want an attorney and wants it set for a jury trial.  Dave Maninnen will check on the status of the deft's mail.  Deft is stating that he is not getting his mail.  Court advises the deft as to his attorney rights.  Court informs the DEFT if he has SSI that he would be eligible for a court appointed attorney.
Defendant James F Baird in court, in custody.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.
